0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Onychomycosis due to dermatophyte, Toenails: apply TOPICALLY to affected toenails once daily for 48 weeks; completely cover the toenail, including folds, bed, hyponychium, and undersurface of toenail plate with each application

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and efficacy not established in pediatric patients

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: No specific contraindications or warnings have been identified.

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono: No specific contraindications or warnings have been identified.

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Efinaconazole is an azole antifungal. Fungicidal activity of efinaconazole is via inhibition of fungal lanosterol 14 alfa-demethylase. Synthesis of ergosterol for fungal cell membranes is catalyzed by fungal lanosterol 14 alfa-demethylase.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Topical
  • topical use only; not for oral, ophthalmic, or intravaginal use
  • apply with the supplied integrated flow-through brush applicator to clean and dry toenail(s); after showering, bathing, or washing, allow at least 10 minutes before application
  • contents are flammable; avoid heat or flame; store bottle upright

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono: improvement in the signs and symptoms of onychomycosis may indicate efficacy

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Tell patient to report persistent irritation at application site.
  • Advise patient to avoid use near heat or open flame since solution is flammable.
  • Side effects may include ingrown toenails, or application site dermatitis, vesicles, or pain.
  • Instruct patient to wait at least 10 minutes after showering, bathing, or washing before applying drug.
